document.docAuthor: Mendes, Diego Matheus De Mello & Rafael, José Albertino
document.masterDocTitle: Redescription of Raggophyllum Nickle, 1967 (Orthoptera: Tettigoniidae: Phaneropterinae) with description of a new species from Brazilian Amazon Rainforest and placement in Microcentrini Brunner von Wattenwyl, 1878

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Redescription of Raggophyllum Nickle, 1967 (Orthoptera: Tettigoniidae: Phaneropterinae) with description of a new species from Brazilian Amazon Rainforest and placement in Microcentrini Brunner von Wattenwyl, 1878

Zootaxa, 4779 (2), 230 - 244. https: // doi. org / 10.11646 / zootaxa. 4779.2.5

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURE 8. Raggophyllum rubrofemoratum sp. nov., holotype male. A: habitus, lateral view; B: head, frontal view; C: head and pronotum, dorsal view; D: head and pronotum, lateral view; E: Thoracic sternites, ventral view; F: foreleg, lateral view; G: midleg, lateral view; H: hindleg, lateral view; I–J: Terminalia in ventral and dorsal view respectively; K: Apex of cerci, dorsal view. Abbreviations: Mes: mesobasisternum; Met: metabasisternum; Cer: cerci; Sty: styli; Pl: subgenital plate.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURE 9. Raggophyllum rubrofemoratum sp. nov., left tegmina of male in dorsal view. Abbreviations: AP: Posterior anal vein; AA: anterior anal vein; CuA: anterior cubital vein; CuP: posterior cubital vein; MA: anterior median vein; MP: posterior median vein; R: radial vein; Sc: subcostal vein.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURE 10. Raggophyllum rubrofemoratum sp. nov., stridulatory file of male. A: left file; B: right file.
figureCitation.captionText-3: FIGURE 11. Raggophyllum rubrofemoratum sp. nov., male internal genitalia.A–B: phallus, ventral view; C–D: phallus, dorsal view; E: phallus with titillator sclerite, ventral view; F: titillator sclerite. Abbreviations: AP: sclerites of apodemes; DF: dorsal fold; DL: dorsal lobe(s); EV: ejaculatory vesicles; TS: titillator sclerite; TI: titillator process; Lw. vl.: lower folds of ventral lobe; Up. vl.: upper folds of ventral lobe.
figureCitation.captionText-4: FIGURE 12. Raggophyllum rubrofemoratum sp. nov., male specimen alive.
figureCitation.captionText-5: FIGURE 13. Map of Raggophyllum species geographical records.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8.
Raggophyllum rubrofemoratum
sp. nov.
, holotype male. A: habitus , lateral view; B: head, frontal view; C: head and pronotum, dorsal view; D: head and pronotum, lateral view; E: Thoracic sternites, ventral view; F: foreleg, lateral view; G: midleg, lateral view; H: hindleg, lateral view; I–J: Terminalia in ventral and dorsal view respectively; K: Apex of cerci, dorsal view. Abbreviations: Mes: mesobasisternum; Met: metabasisternum; Cer: cerci; Sty: styli; Pl: subgenital plate.

FIGURE 9.
Raggophyllum rubrofemoratum
sp. nov.
, left tegmina of male in dorsal view. Abbreviations: AP: Posterior anal vein; AA: anterior anal vein; CuA: anterior cubital vein; CuP: posterior cubital vein; MA: anterior median vein; MP: posterior median vein; R: radial vein; Sc: subcostal vein.

FIGURE 10.
Raggophyllum rubrofemoratum
sp. nov.
, stridulatory file of male. A: left file; B: right file.

FIGURE 11.
Raggophyllum rubrofemoratum
sp. nov.
, male internal genitalia. A–B: phallus, ventral view; C–D: phallus, dorsal view; E: phallus with titillator sclerite, ventral view; F: titillator sclerite. Abbreviations: AP: sclerites of apodemes; DF: dorsal fold; DL: dorsal lobe(s); EV: ejaculatory vesicles; TS: titillator sclerite; TI: titillator process; Lw. vl.: lower folds of ventral lobe; Up. vl.: upper folds of ventral lobe.

subSubSection.paragraph: Coloration . Described based on photos of live specimens ( Fig. 12 ). Body dark green; abdomen light green ventrally. Eyes light purple with brown spots. Fastigium-vertex with beige side stain. Palpus light red. Pronotal disc margin with a narrow red-whitish band. Tegmina dark green, with a stridulatory dark brown region; posterior margin of tegmina with a narrow yellow band. Fore and mid femora dorsally light green, laterally and ventrally red. Hind femur light green, with distal half laterally red. Tibiae red with a light green apex.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 12.
Raggophyllum rubrofemoratum
sp. nov.
, male specimen alive.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. From Latin rubro (red) + femoratum (legs) = red legs, in reference to the striking coloring of the legs.

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements (mm). Holotype ( ♂ ): TL: 25,4; TegL: 34,7; TegH: 14,5; WF: 3,4; PL: 5,9; FF: 5; FT: 5,7; MF: 6,6; MT: 7; HF: 13,3; HT: 13,5; Lplac: 3,4; LC: 3,3.
Habitat . The specimens were collected in a terra firme upland forest.
